title: The Financial Times nameplate typeface
content:
The FT's nameplate uses a customised Times typeface, which I believe is unique to the paper. I would be grateful if someone could direct me to a similar typeface availlable in the public domain.

the FT's nameplate can be found here: [http://www.cida.co.za/2.13\_Media/clippings/Financial\_Times\_Europe-unique...](http://web.archive.org/web/20141016145951/http:/www.cida.co.za/2.13_Media/clippings/Financial_Times_Europe-uniqueJHBcampus-24March03.jpg "http://www.cida.co.za/2.13\_Media/clippings/Financial\_Times\_Europe-uniqueJHBcampus-24March03.jpg")
author: Airwaves

comments.content: Thanks Chris, your recommendation is excellent. Are there any others that have a similar feel?

You're welcome. A few others that spring to mind...  
 [Swift](http://web.archive.org/web/20141016145951/http:/www.gerardunger.com/fontstore/store-swift.html)  
 [Miller](http://web.archive.org/web/20141016145951/http:/www.fontshop.com/?fuseaction=catalog.fontpackage&searchby=manufacturer&displayfontid=FB.103859.0.0)  
 [Farnham](http://web.archive.org/web/20141016145951/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontdetail&displayfontid=FB.118531.3.5)
